009package ImageJ_Demos;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
015import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
016
017/**
018 * This plugin demonstrates how to create and display a 
019 * new byte image (to show the histogram of the input image).
020 */
021public class Create_New_Byte_Image implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
022        
023        ImagePlus im;
024
025        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
026                this.im = im;
027                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
028        }
029
030        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
031                // obtain the histogram of ip:
032                int[] hist = ip.getHistogram();
033                int K = hist.length;
034                
035                // create the histogram image:
036                ImageProcessor histIp = new ByteProcessor(K, 100);
037                histIp.setValue(255);   // white = 255
038                histIp.fill();
039
040                // draw the histogram values as black bars in histIp here, 
041                // for example, using histIp.putpixel(u, v, 0)
042                // ...
043                
044                // compose a nice title:
045                String imTitle = im.getShortTitle();
046                String histTitle = "Histogram of " + imTitle;
047                
048                // display the histogram image:
049                ImagePlus histIm = new ImagePlus(histTitle, histIp);
050                histIm.show(); 
051        }
052}
